meanings.definition: Relating to the art or practice of public speaking.
meanings.sent1: Her oratorical skills captivated the audience during the speech.
meanings.sent2: The professor's oratorical style made the lecture engaging and easy to follow.
meanings.sent3: The oratorical contest at school was both nerve-wracking and exciting.
meanings.sent4: His oratorical prowess turned the mundane topic into a captivating discussion.
meanings.sent5: The oratorical performance left a lasting impression on everyone present.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of a skilled or persuasive speaker.
meanings.sent1: The politician's oratorical abilities helped him win over the crowd.
meanings.sent2: Her oratorical mannerisms were polished and effective in conveying her message.
meanings.sent3: The parrot's oratorical skills amused the visitors at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: His oratorical charm was like a magnet, drawing people to listen attentively.
meanings.sent5: The oratorical talent of the young debater was evident in every speech.
